document.docAuthor: de Brito, Victor & Buckup, Paulo Andreas
document.masterDocTitle: The fish fauna of the upper Piraí drainage, a transposed mountain river system in southeastern, Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The fish fauna of the upper Piraí drainage, a transposed mountain river system in southeastern, Brazil

bibRefCitation.author: Eigenmann CH
bibRefCitation.refString: Eigenmann CH (1908) Preliminary descriptions of new genera and species of tetragonopterid characins. (Zoological Results of the Thayer Brazilian expedition.). Bulletin of the Museum of Comparative Zoology 52 (6): 91 - 106.

subSubSection.paragraph: Geographic distribution: Paraíba do Sul and Doce river basins and coastal rivers of Rio de Janeiro state

caption.paragraph: Table 2. List of the freshwater fishes of upper Piraí river drainage.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Figure 2. Fish species collected in upper Piraí river drainage. A.
Astyanax giton , MNRJ
37986, 63.6 mm SL. B.
Hypomasticus mormyrops , MNRJ
46698,128.6 mm SL. C.
Astyanax intermedius , MNRJ
43805, 77.2 mm SL. D.
Hoplias malabaricus , MNRJ
43830, 70.8 mm SL. E.
Astyanax sp.
aff. scabripinnis , MNRJ 36427, 71.8 mm SL. F.
Characidium lauroi , MNRJ
43823, 57.3 mm SL. G.
Brycon opalinus , MNRJ
47259, 116.6 mm SL. H.
Characidium vidali , MNRJ
43807, 66.6 mm SL. I.
Oligosarcus hepsetus , MNRJ
43812, 63.1 mm SL.

Diagnosis:
Astyanax intermedius
differs from
A. giton
by body depth less than 41% of SL and abrupt reduction of tooth size posterior to the fifth dentary tooth ( Melo 2001a ). Also, in contrast with
A. giton
, the posterior portion of pelvic fin in
A. intermedius
does not surpass the urogenital opening in this species.
Astyanax intermedius
can be distinguished from
Astyanax sp.
aff. scabripinnis , by the presence of 5 cusps in most dentary teeth and regular sized adipose fin.
